articles.title: Institution of evil labor laws slammed in S. Korea
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Institution of evil labor laws slammed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Korean Trade Unions held a meeting of workers throughout South Korea in Seoul on Nov. 3 protesting against the institution of the evil labor laws.
 At the meeting the organization accused the government authorities of unilaterally pushing forward the institution of the three evil laws such as the "law on unions of government employees" and called for their repeal.    
 It vowed to prevent the unjust labor bills aimed at deteriorating working conditions, etc. from passing through the national assembly.

articles.title: South side's delegation here
articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il met groups of 22 triplets at the April 25 House of Culture in November Juche 85 (1996) where the 3rd meeting of officials of youth affairs of the Korean People's Army was going on.
 He was pleased that the triplets President Kim Il Sung loved so much in his lifetime were serving in the army. He meticulously asked them about their parents and their military service.    
 He had a picture taken with the triplets and gave them gold wristwatches as gifts, wishing them good health and successes in their military service.
